sentence.Network_en: That failure knocked me off my pedestal.
sentence.Network_cn: 那次失败将我赶下了神坛。

sentence.Network_en: At the very top of the steps was a bust of Shakespeare on a pedestal.
sentence.Network_cn: 就在台阶顶端的基座上有一尊莎士比亚胸像.

sentence.Network_en: Since childhood, I put my own parents on a pedestal. I felt they could do no wrong.
sentence.Network_cn: 从童年起，我就把自己的父母当作偶像崇拜，觉得他们做的一切都是对的。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French piédestal, from Italian piedestallo, from piè 'foot' (from Latin pes, ped-, which later influenced the spelling) + di 'of' + stallo 'stall'

entry.def: A pedestal is the base on which something such as a statue stands.

example.ex: ...a larger than life sized bronze statue on a granite pedestal.
example.tran: 安放在花岗岩底座上的比真人尺寸还要大的青铜雕像

entry.tran: 受崇拜/ 不再受崇拜
entry.def: If you put someone on a pedestal, you admire them very much and think that they cannot be criticized. If someone is knocked off a pedestal they are no longer admired.

example.ex: Since childhood, I put my own parents on a pedestal. I felt they could do no wrong...
example.tran: 从童年起，我就把自己的父母当作偶像崇拜，觉得他们做的一切都是对的。

example.ex: That failure knocked me off my pedestal.
example.tran: 那次失败将我赶下了神坛。

means.word_mean: 2. a position of great esteem (and supposed superiority);
3. an architectural support or base (as for a column or statue)

auth_sentence.content: His elegant white pedestal pieces retain their sleekly sinuous appeal.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: His elegant white pedestal pieces retain their sleekly sinuous appeal.

auth_sentence.content: The insubordinate stood above us, as if on a pedestal.

auth_sentence.content: Now the games-captain was tottering if not already fallen from the pedestal.

means.word_mean: 把某人奉为完人；盲目崇拜某人

sentences.en: Don’t try to put her on a pedestal, she’s as guilty as the rest of them!
sentences.cn: 别盲目崇拜她了，她跟其他人一样，并不是完人！
